definition: to trace sth back to its source/to get to the bottom of sth
to sculpt/to carve/musical instrument (old)
to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
to pursue sth back to its origins/to trace back to the source/to get to the bottom of sth
to get to the heart of the matter
lit. to examine roots and inquire at the base (idiom); to get to the bottom of sth
to track sth to its roots
see 追根究底[zhui1 gen1 jiu1 di3]
erhua variant of 追根究底[zhui1 gen1 jiu1 di3]

sentences.english: The author firstly reviews the historical evolution of WTO secretariat.
sentences.chinese: 笔者首先从历史的角度对秘书处做出了追根溯源。

sentences.english: Maintain an inquisitive mind and do not accept the status quo.
sentences.chinese: 保持一颗追根问底地心，不接受”现状“。

sentences.english: Efforts to limit scrutiny of embarrassing events isn't unusual in China.
sentences.chinese: 限制对敏感事件追根问底的举措在中国并不罕见。

sentences.english: We decided to start from scratch and question everything.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定从头开始并对不了解的一切问题追根问底。

sentences.english: It can be hard to keep track of the many religious holidays.
sentences.chinese: 我们很难对大多数宗教节日追根朔源。

sentences.english: The recent economic downturn has come about due to many different factors.
sentences.chinese: 近期是经济低迷时期，若要追根溯源，更是不一而足。

sentences.english: One must be thorough in acquiring knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 求学问一定要有追根究底的精神。

sentences.english: Children always love to dive to the bottom of a subject.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们总是喜欢追根问底。

sentences.english: Argumentative , that is, right now the end of a bar.
sentences.chinese: 追根究底，就是对现在的一种终结吧。

sentences.english: It is impossible to trace out by history what kind of man he was.
sentences.chinese: 不可能通过历史追根溯源查出他是一个什么样的人。

sentences.english: Anjiacha gold deposit is a bedrock gold deposit which was discovered by tracing placer gold.
sentences.chinese: 安家岔金矿床是由砂金追根溯源而找到的矿床。

sentences.english: The second-part studies the origin of the ecocriticism.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分追根溯源探讨生态批评的理论渊源。

definition: to trace sth back to its origin
to get to the heart of the matter
to pursue sth back to its origins/to trace back to the source/to get to the bottom of sth
lit. to dig up the root/to get to the heart of (the matter)
to track sth to its roots
lit. to examine roots and inquire at the base (idiom); to get to the bottom of sth
see 追根溯源[zhui1 gen1 su4 yuan2]
the whys and the wherefores/the detailed story/root cause
to reveal the inside story/to expose sb's secrets
to trace something to its source (idiom)
lit. to examine roots and inquire at the base (idiom); to get to the bottom of sth
see 追根究底[zhui1 gen1 jiu1 di3]
to study/to examine/to probe/to study the underlying principles
to dig up roots and inquire at the base (idiom); to get to the bottom of sth
to originate
ultimately/in the final analysis/after all/when all is said and done
